kpi-active-tooltip: Confirmed cases minus recovered minus deceased minus transferred to other states
data-update-warning-message: Data being updated—numbers may change on the fly. Apologies.
map-discaimer: Boundaries are for reference only. Accuracy is not warranted.
description-kpi: Items shown here are based on DHS bulletin everyday. Numbers in the bracket indicate changes from the previous day
description-hotspots-map: The geographic areas marked here are based on the list of Hotspots declared by Government of Kerala everyday. The map is just for indication only. Accuracy and authenticity are provisional
description-district-trend-map: The map shows district-wise trend in positive cases. Place your mouse/finger to get the data about each district.
description-trend-chart: The graphs shows cumulative numbers of patients everyday.
description-daily-increase: The graph displays new positive cases reported everyday and its trend-line
description-testing-trend: The graphs displays total number of tests so far and number of tests every day
description-patients—age-breakup: The chart displays the age group of patients and the gender split-up in each group.
description-patients—gender-breakup: The pie chart shows the gender proportion of patients.
description-prefecture-trajectory: This graphs shows the cumulative number of patients every day in each district with more than ten cases
description-prefecture-data: This table shows the district-wise cumulative data of positive cases, active cases, recoveries, deaths, and also the trend diagram for each district
description-db: Anonymized datasets from this dashboard project are periodically published and archived under Open Data Commons Attribution License v1.0 (ODC-BY 1.0). You can freely download and reuse them from
description-paper: An article describing the underlying philosophy and objectives of this dashboard is available at
citation-instruction: Appropriate citations of our preprint and/or dataset on your project, reports, and other publications is highly appreciated.
description-contact-cases: The graph displays contact patients count and import patients count reported everyday and its trend line
bad-weather-warning: In spite of our best efforts, there may be delay in updates due to the ongoing rains and power failures. Stay safe.
